review_title: If you love the work, you'll love the job
pros: Freedom, independence, flexibility, a voice in the org, impact on students, focus on teaching and improving students' lives, encouragement to do part time industry work to facilitate pay, ability to present a project and run with it
cons: Small organization (which has its pros and cons), not yet very virtual, below industry average pay. If pay is your top concern, you should find a new industry (1), but (2) you will find CU, which is a wonderful school, to not be your favorite employer.

pros: My colleagues are awesome, the ones who stick around anyway...
cons: You can't survive on the pay. The benefits are horrible.

pros: Emplyees are given autonomy over thier positions.

The Students. The Students. The Students. Most coworkers are great to work with and want students to succeed. Convenient drive. Supervisors lets you work, come and go as you need to do your job. Plans to improve pay and programs; only time will tell if anything truly changes.
cons: VERY low pay for skills. No support for improvement of services, even if costs are same. No room for advancement, especially for women, and until recently, minorities. Little to no access to leadership, and if your supervisor or VP is not supportive, you might as well be invisible. Technology and programming is horribly behind. Quick turnover because good and talented people don't stay.

pros: The faculty people that I interacted with were helpful and interesting. The students were a very mixed bag.
cons: The pay is awful. I’m now getting paid much better at a competing college.

pros: The university president is outstanding and forward-thinking; the colleagues I have are dedicated and knowledgeable scholars in their fields and are warm and friendly.
cons: Faculty salaries are insufficient and need to be raised.

pros: Tuition free degree after being there for a certain number of years
cons: Low employee morale, strong "good ol' boys club" feeling, no annual raises

pros: This position provides students with exceptional pay, flexible hours, and good experience.
cons: I am no longer familiar with the supervisor.

job_title: Associate Dean of Nursing in Seattle, WA
pros: Excellent University I am the program of the nursing masters program
cons: I have no issues with Cumberland

pros: Great school; online RN-BSN program is wonderful!
cons: So far there have not been any cons

pros: Very nice faculty within the School of Nursing.  Very helpful staff.
cons: Low pay for work demand.  Lacks overall organization.  Curriculum needs significant updating.

pros: Wonderful place to work. Family Friendly!
